## 판결문 요약

84 F.3d 191
    70 Fair Empl.Prac.Cas. (BNA) 1625
    Virginia WELLER, Plaintiff-Appellee,v.CITATION OIL & GAS CORPORATION, and Ralph Hollingshead,Defendants-Appellants.
    No. 94-20439.
    United States Court of Appeals,Fifth Circuit.
    June 3, 1996.
    
      Douglas E. Hamel, Suzanne M. Lehman, Vinson & Elkins, Houston, TX, for Appellants.
      Eliot P. Tucker, Mandell & Wright, Houston, TX, for appellee.
      Appeals from the United States District Court for the Southern District of Texas.
      Before GARWOOD, EMILIO M. GARZA and DEMOSS, Circuit Judges.
      EMILIO M. GARZA, Circuit Judge:
    
    
      1
      Defendants Citation Oil & Gas Corporation ("Citation") and Ralph Hollingshead appeal a jury verdict awarding plaintiff Virginia Weller damages on her employment discrimination claims.   We reverse.
    
    
      2
      * Weller worked as a Contract Administrator in Citation's Contract and Marketing Department.   The department consisted of Weller, her supervisor Ralph Hollingshead, and one other female employee.   Through Weller's work monitoring natural gas stored in the El Paso Natural Gas Pipeline, Weller discovered that Citation owned a quantity of gas which was not reflected in Citation's records.   Before completing a memorandum to Hollingshead detailing her discovery, Weller informed the Executive Vice President's secretary about the gas.
